conversations.content: It looks like Alice sent me an urgent email yesterday. Could you check it and fulfill her request?

<function_thought>
The user has requested that I check an urgent email from Alice sent yesterday and fulfill her request. To proceed, I first need to determine the current date so I can identify what "yesterday" refers to. I will use the `get_current_day` tool to retrieve today's date in ISO format.
</function_thought>

<function_call>[get_current_day()]</function_call>

<final_answer></final_answer>

<function_thought>
The current date is 2024-05-19. Therefore, "yesterday" refers to 2024-05-18. I now need to retrieve the received emails linked to the shopping account to locate Alice's urgent email from that date. I will use the `get_shopping_linked_received_emails` tool to obtain all received emails, which will be marked as read after retrieval.
</function_thought>

<function_call>[get_shopping_linked_received_emails()]</function_call>

<final_answer></final_answer>

<function_thought>
Alice sent an urgent email on 2024-05-18 requesting a replacement light bulb. She provided her shopping account credentials: username "alicemiller" and password "alice.m.123". Before fulfilling her request, I must first log in to her shopping account using the `login_shopping_account` tool.
</function_thought>

<function_call>[login_shopping_account(username="alicemiller", password="alice.m.123")]</function_call>

<final_answer></final_answer>

<function_thought>
I have successfully logged into Alice Miller's shopping account. Now I need to search for a suitable light bulb replacement. I'll use the `search_product` function with the category "Home" and the product name "light bulb" to find relevant items.
</function_thought>

<function_call>[search_product(product_name="light bulb", category="Home")]</function_call>

<final_answer></final_answer>

<function_thought>
The search for "light bulb" in the "Home" category returned no results. I should try a broader search without specifying the category to ensure I don't miss relevant products. I'll search for products with "light bulb" in the product name without limiting by category.
</function_thought>

<function_call>[search_product(product_name="light bulb")]</function_call>

<final_answer></final_answer>

<function_thought>
The search for "light bulb" returned no results, even without category filtering. I should try searching for similar terms like "bulb" or "light" to find potential replacements. Let me search for products with "bulb" in the product name.
</function_thought>

<function_call>[search_product(product_name="bulb")]</function_call>

<final_answer></final_answer>
